issue.title: [Website] http://arrow.apache.org doesn't redirect to https
issue.body:
***Note**: This issue was originally created as [ARROW-5417](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5417). Please see the [migration documentation](https://gist.github.com/toddfarmer/12aa88361532d21902818a6044fda4c3) for further details.*

### Original Issue Description:
This should be a simple (for someone sufficiently authorized) config change somewhere.

comments.body:
***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5417?focusedCommentId=16847690) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I wonder if this is an apache infrastructure issue. [www.apache.org](http://www.apache.org/) has the same issue.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5417?focusedCommentId=16913764) by Wes McKinney (wesm):*
Appears to be an INFRA issue. Might be worth asking infra about what's going on

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5417?focusedCommentId=16913776) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I'll make the INFRA ticket and see what they say.

***Note**: [Comment](https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ARROW-5417?focusedCommentId=16913783) by Neal Richardson (npr):*
I'll close this since it's reported there and there's nada we can do about it here.
